evidence.snippet: Audio capture in public spaces must be narrowly tailored; municipalities must document minimization controls and public notice prior to enabling new microphones.

evidence.title: Boca Raton Smart-City Privacy Guidance
evidence.snippet: University partnerships using cloud analytics should complete a DPIA that covers secondary use of student information and cross-border storage.

risks.description: The brief proposes cloud storage for plate scans without describing a data processing agreement or audit rights, exposing the city to uncontrolled secondary use of student travel patterns.
risks.mitigation: Execute a formal DPA with the vendor, limit raw data retention to 30 days, and require encryption key ownership by the city.

risks.description: Audio is disabled but could be toggled later; there is no consent or opt-out workflow for students despite Sunshine and FERPA expectations.
risks.mitigation: Publish a privacy impact summary, add opt-out signage near dorm entries, and notify campus governance before enabling microphones.

requirements.description: Complete and publish a data protection impact assessment covering ALPR/video storage, sharing, and data-subject rights.
Draft a vendor DPA with audit clauses and an incident notice SLA before ingesting any plate data into the cloud.

notes: Privacy counsel recommends HOLD until a formal DPIA, DPA, and notice package exist for FAU corridor monitoring.
